Casper is a complicating movie, i mean it can have it's heartwarming moments with the father-daughter relationship with Dr. James Harvey and his daughter Kathleen (or Kat for short) with the latter having a good relationship with the main character and decent gags, unfortunately at the same time there are a couple of things that drag this movie down like the jokes, the cliqued antagonist and the unnecessary pop-culture references. Outside of Christina Ricci and Bill Pullman it also has cast like Eric Idle, Brad Garrett, Joe Alaskey (may he rest in peace) and Ben Stein along with some surprising cameos like Dan Aykroyd, Fred Rogers, Clint Eastwood, Jess Harnell and unfortunately Mel Gibson, anyways my personal recommendation is that if want to watch something spooky & fun then maybe check it out if not your'e probably better of watching "The Nightmare Before Christmas" sure Casper not the best film that came of 1995 but it's certainly not that terrible either.

Thirty years ago, critics didn’t like it — even I thought it was just so-so. But compared to today’s unimaginative and repetitive movies, it’s now a charming, wholesome, state-of-the-art  (even to today’s standards) piece of entertainment with impressive special effects. Bill Pullman feels underused in the film, but Christina Ricci and Casper make a great duo. A great family movie.
